story:
Once upon a time, in a lush and vibrant village in the heart of Brazil, there lived a kind and curious little girl named Isabela. Isabela's greatest joy was exploring the lush forests that surrounded her home, where she would discover the most amazing creatures and plants.

One day, while wandering through the forest, Isabela came across a tiny, beautiful bird with feathers of the most brilliant shades of blue and green. The bird was perched on a branch, singing a sweet and enchanting melody. Isabela was immediately captivated by the bird's beauty and song.

She watched the bird for what seemed like hours, until finally, the bird flew down to a nearby bush and began to peck at the ground. Curious, Isabela approached the bush and saw that the bird was unearthing small, shiny stones.

Isabela asked the bird, "Why are you collecting those stones, little one?"

The bird replied, "These stones have a magical power. When strung together and worn as a necklace, they will grant the wearer the ability to understand and communicate with all the creatures of the forest."

Isabela's eyes widened with excitement. "I would love to be able to talk to all the animals in the forest! Can you teach me how to make the necklace?"

The bird agreed, and for the next several days, Isabela worked tirelessly to collect the right stones and string them together into a beautiful necklace. And as soon as she placed it around her neck, she was able to understand and communicate with all the creatures of the forest.

She spent her days talking to the monkeys, playing with the parrots, and learning from the wise old turtles. The forest became her playground and her classroom, and she was the happiest she had ever been.

But as time passed, Isabela realized that the true magic of the necklace was not in the ability to talk to animals, but in the connections she had made with them. She had formed bonds with the creatures of the forest, and they had become her friends and companions.

And so, Isabela decided to pass on the necklace to another curious and kind-hearted child, so that they too could experience the magic of the forest and the joy of making connections with all the creatures who lived there.

The necklace was passed down from child to child, each one learning the true magic of the forest and the importance of connections with others. And Isabela, even after she had grown up and moved away from her village, always remembered the lessons she had learned in the forest and the friends she had made there.

And with that, my dear daughter, it's time for us to say goodnight. May you always remember the magic of connections and the joy of discovery, just like Isabela did in our story. Sweet dreams, my darling.
